msContents.summary: Receipt for money-taxes paid on behalf of a church

msItem.note: Side 1: 13 lines written with the fibers
Side 2: 1 lines (different hand) written with the fibers
Large rounded uncials with some flourish
Abbreviations are sometimes marked with a dot above the final letter, as well as by the usual diagonal stroke (cf. P.Oxy. 1053)
The letters on side 2 (AKA.A...BERAXAKAM E..) are unintelligible, perhaps magical

supportDesc.support: 24 x 10.2 cm. A single long papyrus leaf, mostly intact but with small worm-holes throughout; original large ink blot at ll. 10-11; adhesive stains on verso from a previous mounting.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt for the Egypt Exploration Fund, probably in 1906; on temporary display in Boston in 1915; donated to Princeton Theological Seminary in 1915 through an arrangement with Prof. William Park Armstrong.

div.ab: Paid to the credit of the church by Apphouas, presbyter, for the money-dues of the 10th indiction, 12 solidi of gold less 51 carats on the private standard, total 12 solidi of gold less 51 carats private standard, and no more. Phaophi 8, 11th indiction, through me, Phib, scribe. Once for all.
